q: Is DIY flood-barrier installation realistic for homeowners?
a: DIY kits work for single-opening doorways but require precision alignment within 2 mm. Misalignment can cause leaks under pressure. Professional installation ensures engineering compliance and warranty validity.
Common issues include under-torqued anchors, uneven gasket compression, and unsealed masonry pores. Each reduces hydrostatic resistance by 15–30 %.

q: How much does professional installation cost compared to DIY?
a: Professional labor averages 15–20 % of total system cost. Considering avoided failures and warranty coverage, ROI typically occurs within one event cycle.

q: Can I install panels and have them certified later?
a: Yes, we offer post-inspection certification if installation meets torque, alignment, and material specs. Non-compliant installs require retrofit adjustments.

q: Where can I learn about installation standards?
a: Review our installation guide and Doorway Flood Panel specifications.
